Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2008 09:58AM Di53 wrote: back to the  ocologist today for a checkup ....  having the TAC split up into individual doses has me depressed... and feeling very lonely.... taking A first... every 2 weeks until its done then the next and the next....so i went from 12 weeks to end to 28 weeks to end... not getting help from my daughter even tho she's a 1/2 hour away... she makes me feel like i'm imposing, so i quit asking for her support. My church has been bringing in a few meals to help me out, they know i dont feel well and dont stay for long.   Ifeel guilting accepting their help when my daughter wont help me.... but what else can I do Thanks for listening... Thanks for letting me cry on my keyboard.. most of all thanks for letting me know  that my attempts with packing tape and the lint roller arent stupid after all.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2008 08:49PM Di53 wrote: Bridget, thats so awesome  that that is happening! your  daughter must be so proud to be part of it!!  My brain is fried tonight....spent the day with my daughter and trying not to let her  know how bad  my back is hurting...its not as bad as before tho.   I have taken vicoden a couple times today and its keeping it in check.  I need to sleep now so i'll check in tomorrow!

Posts.Content: May 23, 2008 11:28PM Di53 wrote: well...i'm back....feeling a tad better....neutropenia SUCKS!  Taxol is beating me up chewing me up...then repeating...
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2008 08:41AM - edited Mar 24, 2008 09:21AM by Di53 I am on emend...it works wonderfully as I don't get nauseous...but i'm also on 2 other nausea meds too.  It kinda bothers me that its my most expensive co-pay at $11 and i'm on a very limited income... and that every 2 weeks is hard.  I'm just glad i have insurance to to pay for it as its an expensive medicine. licorice, hopefully you can catch a nap at chemo :)    I also am not ready to "be"  my plastic surgeon was able to put in my tissue expander at my mastectomy and was able to fully expand it just before chemo started.   grannie, i agree with beegirl, you need to try a lot to see what helps you most.....I found brach's cinnamon disks are the only thing that helps.   I also drink hot peppermint tea, its something I drank before when i was sick with flu or colds...and just this weekend remembered that i had some in the cupboard and tried and to my delight it tasted ok... it soothes my stomach a little bit. Hope this is the start of a good week for everyone!
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2008 01:17PM - edited Apr 12, 2008 04:48PM by Di53 40something - xanax is an antidepressant.  It's something you want to talk over with your doctor.  I dont take it every day..just when i feel myself getting low.   I work hard at not letting myself get that low!   My T is taxol according to my oncol.  I get my chemo in Flint. Evie congrats on the laptop :)   its almost time to go sit on porches and post from there!  i think  the worst part of the hair thing is how cold i get with my nakid head.  That and my head is big...so to fit into a gently used wig is difficult...they just dont fit :D  so so far its scarf land  for me ok...does anyone get cold..like cold all the way to your bones??  my temp is normal,  its 71f in the house..i have a scarf on, and flannel jammies and a fleece shirt with a hoodie on with the hood up and two pairs of socks...under my flannel sheets and quilt and prayer quilt and a down filled blanket....takes an hour or so for me to feel warm  again and a hot shower  doesnt work...(like its hot..more like lukewarm as per my ps.    drinking hot peppermint tea too.  The cats love it as they can lay on me then :D   LOL i could stay warm in a snow bank in these clothes normally!!   any other ideas for warmin up?
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 09:23AM Di53 wrote: ::WAVES WILDLY::  Good morning everyone!...its been an ewwy week...the back has been crabby and objecting to the taxol...so i've been not on the computer as much...I everyone i know has come down with a virus plus seasonal allergies...nothing like hiding out.   Me and the sewing machine have decided that we cant give each other anything...so...its me and quilts for now...Today is day 2 of 12 for taxol....not looking forward to it at all.     I figured out how in heck to add pictures to here so that you can see PJ's quilt... and his airplane pillow top that I made for him yesterday.

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 02:58AM Di53 wrote: ITs 3am and i'm up with the night owls....  Kids drivning past the house on quads (4 wheelers with noisy mufflers)   and then stopping under the street light to chat and rev their engines....   ::rolls eyes::   the lady next door with 3 under 4 should be happy with them too! Hugs to you all who are having sweet dreams... and bigger ones to you who are having trouble sleeping too

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 08:06PM - edited Apr 11, 2008 08:12PM by Di53 Congrats Aurora!! My oncologist told me today no more adriamycin!!  Wooohoo!!!!! i don't have to take the next two... he said its done its job.. time for T....thats the bad news... every week for 12 weeks.... ::sigh::   one step backwards.. but i feel like i took two steps forward with the last of the A...now to go read the paper on it and see what to look forward to  40something..........the depression.. tell your doc hopefully he'll give you something for it,  I have xanax for it, and i've been seeing rainbows and sun dogs a lot, God's way of saying he's here with me is how I see it.  The storms are over for today! thats a good thing...Tennis is starting and you have your adorable wigs... thats a good thing...You don't have to take my 12 weeks of T......THATS A VERY GOOD thing..you don't have me living near you bugging you to go watch "the last lecture"... (even tho it is an excellent thing to watch)  lets see... what else can I get you to do to think Tiggerish  :)    it was in teh 70s today!!   the last of the winter snow might show up on Sunday... but its SPRING!! and the daffodils are sticking their heads out to see if its time to bloom... did Imention that the rain is almost over for the day??? HUGS and may you be blessed with smiles tonight and tomorrow to make you smile

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 04:03PM Di53 wrote: Back from the oncologists office...because of my reaction to TAC, we're splitting things up and i'll be doing them one at a time.  Adriamycin (sp?) is the first one that i'll have since its the roughest.  We're switching from once every 3 weeks to every other week.....and of course today after my posting I went and brushed my hair and TADA.....its falling out big time today.  My daughter, son and I had a buzzcut party, and I no longer have hair! My kids bought me a lovely hat and a beautiful blue scarf to use as a covering. My scalp itches..any ideas on what might make it itch less?
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2008 04:45PM Di53 wrote: My oncologist walked in to our appt today...  looked at me and I promptly broke down and  started crying..... he zipped across the room, put his forehead against mine in a sweet way and hugged and hugged me!  I told him I was depressed and after we had a sweet talk with lotsa hugs, I told him I was so glad that he is my oncologist.  He told me my blood work has  raised back up to great levels and I dont have to see him for 3 weeks.  He also wants me to call no matter what time when the depression gets too bad.  I then zipped to Verizon to have them look at my stupid cell phone (the bottom 6 buttons quit working)... they immediately replaced it! so that made me feel good.  I was terrified though that someone was sick and hid in the corner with my mask. 40somethingMom,  I had my first  TAC and my white blood count dropped to zero.  It took 5 days for it to rebound with neupogen EACH DAY!  In order to keep me out of the hospital each time I get chemo we had to split it up into individual sections. HUGS and prayers for the words of encouragement
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2008 06:12PM - edited Mar 22, 2008 06:14PM by Di53 Checking in today to see how we all are... * Sorry Donna to hear about yoru RBC, hope things perk up * Pam, sounds like we all need to come help you eat that prime rib * artsee I'm glad your wbc went up and you can go to your celebrations tomorrow * Rachel, sorry that you are tired today, and I understand about the heartburn... I feel like burp central at times.  I've been sucking on Brach's cinnamon disks they seem to help me a bit not sure why...you need the protein though from the meat, so make sure you are getting protein, maybe in a hard boiled egg? *  C-Babe awesome news! My problem today is that everyone that stops by is bringing me chocolate... and chocolate tastes like something i'd rather not say right now... to freeze or not to freeze...if my taste doesnt come back until the chemo is over... it will be at least 28 weeks.  Seperating out the chemo into 3 sections and getting them every 2 weeks is ruining my chocoholic lifestyle.  Whats a girl to do???? HAppy Easter!!

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 08:23AM - edited Mar 7, 2008 08:31AM by Di53 Hi All, I started out in the wrong Feb chemo start thread and just got kicked over to here.. the correct thread. I had my mastectomy on Jan 9th and had my port put Feb 12th, I had my nurse visit on the 20th and my first chemo was on the 21st.   I am er/pr pos and her2 neg.  Grade II invasive.  i had two areas in my breast no where near each other ::rolls eyes:: well, chemo number one is over...that was Feb 21..ended up with neutropenia and in the hospital for 5 days and after 4 neupogen shots, i'm home i'm feeling better...but have a runny nose and it seems like my allergies are worse.  I finally got the nurse to give me pain medicine at the same time as the neupogen shot and that helped my backache out a lot..it was a lot better than sitting in the middle of the bed rocking from the backache the shot gave me.  today is my visit with my oncologist before chemo #2, and i'm hoping my blood tests come out as good as the last one at the hospital.  I am scared!  there is a family history on my mother's side of the family of severe negative reactions after starting cancer treatments.  My oncologist knows about it and is working with me! I am so lucky to have doctors that listen to my fears, and have worked with me.   I have a tissue expander in also.  It's currently nicely expanded and everything on that is on hold until the chemo part is over.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2008 11:13AM Di53 wrote: Well, the adriamycin iv from thursday kicked butt again... i slept for 13.5 hours after it.  the neulasta show friday made me achy and yesterday spent it in bed tryign to get rid of lower back/ scapula pain.   I'd love to go sit in a hot tub but we all know thats a no no. My nausea is worse this time also, taking Emend, Compazine and one other med for it..... ::sigh::   I've been working on trying to stay upbeat.  Thank you to our thread for helping!

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2008 07:23AM - edited Apr 11, 2008 07:28AM by Di53 My third adriamycin was rough coming out of... felt better Tuesday this week and good on Wednesday and Thursday was round 4 of adriamycin... (my last chemo day I figured out will be September 18th) 2 more rounds to go.  This round I had a backache, the abdominal cramps and the need for sleep! I also had watched Diane Sawyer on Wednesday night with Randy Pausch.  What a show! Made me appreciate all the good that I have in my life, including you all.  Invisible faces we may be, we all have concern and care about everyone in our thread.  If you have 106 minutes, do a google search for "The Last Lecture" and watch it, he has cancer, and his outlook on life is amazing! The google version of his speech is the whole one including introductions.  The YouTube one is only missing those. Happy Friday!!  Hopefully we all will have a great weekend, and a touch of sunshine  somehow!  (I'm getting rain/snow.. so my sunshine will be in some other special way!)   Prayers and caring from me come your way!
